meanings.definition: relating to the flow of matter
meanings.sent1: The rheological properties of the liquid affect how it moves.
meanings.sent2: The scientist conducted a rheological analysis of the substance's flow.
meanings.sent3: The rheological characteristics of the slime made it tricky to clean up.
meanings.sent4: Her dance had a rheological grace, flowing smoothly across the stage.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the rheological nature of lava can help predict volcanic eruptions.

meanings.definition: the study of the flow of matter
meanings.sent1: She found rheological fascinating and decided to pursue it in college.
meanings.sent2: Rheological involves analyzing how different substances move.
meanings.sent3: The professor's passion for rheological was contagious among students.
meanings.sent4: In rheological, researchers explore how liquids and solids flow.
meanings.sent5: The library had a section dedicated to rheological books and research papers.

meanings.definition: the behavior of materials under stress
meanings.sent1: The rheological of the metal under pressure was carefully studied.
meanings.sent2: Engineers use rheological to understand how materials respond to force.
meanings.sent3: The rheological of the rubber band was tested by stretching it.
meanings.sent4: The rheological of the bridge under heavy traffic was a concern for the engineers.
meanings.sent5: Learning about rheological helps in designing structures that can withstand different pressures.
